snippet.title: Australia Is Building One Of The World's Longest Electric Highways
snippet.content:
Australia is taking the electric car revolution one step further by announcing a $4 million super-long electric highway, or a series of fast charging electric vehicle stations. Image via AP
Queensland's Electric Super Highway will be about 2,000 kilometers, or about 1,931km, stretching from the Gold Coast on the state's southern border to Cairns in the far north. 18 charging stations will span the highway, all that allow vehicles charge in 30 minutes.
The Swedes, geniuses that they are, have long led the world in conquering the moose test. But here's one thing they don't seem prepared for: the kangaroo test.
The Queensland government will make the use of the electric highway is free to incentivise Aussies to go electric, according to a Queensland Government . Environment Minister Steven Miles said he expects electric vehicle ownership to increase.
Sweden introduced the idea of an "electric highway" last year, using instead of charging stations. Canada boasts the world's large highway with fast-charging stations, (around 9,656km), and the U.S. is building a similar in Oregon, Washington and California.
WATCH MORE: Car News

sindex.name: Australia Is Building One Of The World
